metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8743 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP Server, in all releases prior to 2.2.32 and 2.4.25, was liberal in the whitespace accepted from requests and sent in response lines and headers. Accepting these different behaviors represented a security concern when httpd participates in any chain of proxies or interacts with back-end application servers, either through mod_proxy or using conventional CGI mechanisms, and may result in request smuggling, response splitting and cache pollution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> Notes from Debian "The fix is not fully backwards compatible so upstream have created a new option to control this behaviour. Affects: 2.2.0 to 2.4.23." mdeslaur> This fix no longer allows underscores in host names. Debian added a patch to restore the behaviour: https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=851357 http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-dev/201702.mbox/%3C20170202125319.GA15948%40redhat.com%3E  The new configuration option doesn't entirely preserve backwards compatibility: https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=60783

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.2').
